Hadith #8.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One after Carnal Relations Eats, Drinks, Reads, Enters a Masjid, Dyes Hair, Uses Fragrance and So On
Hadith #8.arabicText: 8ـ أَبُو دَاوُدَ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ فَضَالَةَ بْنِ أَيُّوبَ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ الْجُنُبِ وَالْحَائِضِ يَتَنَاوَلاَنِ مِنَ الْمَسْجِدِ الْمَتَاعَ يَكُونُ فِيهِ قَالَ نَعَمْ وَلَكِنْ لاَ يَضَعَانِ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ شَيْئاً.
Hadith #8.englishText: 8. Abu Dawud has narrated from al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id from Fadalah ibn Ayyub from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “I once asked abu ’Abd Allah , about one, who experiencing sexual relation or Hayd (menses), picks up something from Masjid. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is permissible but they must not leave something in Masjid.”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/150)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #10.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One after Carnal Relations Eats, Drinks, Reads, Enters a Masjid, Dyes Hair, Uses Fragrance and So On
Hadith #10.arabicText: 10ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ أَخِيهِ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ زُرْعَةَ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يُجْنِبُ ثُمَّ يُرِيدُ النَّوْمَ قَالَ إِنْ أَحَبَّ أَنْ يَتَوَضَّأَ فَلْيَفْعَلْ وَالْغُسْلُ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ وَأَفْضَلُ مِنْ ذَلِكَ فَإِنْ هُوَ نَامَ وَلَمْ يَتَوَضَّأْ وَلَمْ يَغْتَسِلْ فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ شَيْ‏ءٌ إِنْ شَاءَ الله تَعَالَى.
Hadith #10.englishText: 10. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id from his brother al-Hassan from Zur’ah, from Sanaa ‘ah who has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam) about a man who experiences sexual relation and wants to sleep. He (the Imam) said, ‘If he likes he can take Wudu’. However, Ghusl (bath) is more desirable to me and I prefer it; and it is better than that, however, if he has gone to sleep without Wudu’ and without Ghusl (bath) there is nothing obligatory for him to do, by the will of Allah, most High.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/151)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #11.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One after Carnal Relations Eats, Drinks, Reads, Enters a Masjid, Dyes Hair, Uses Fragrance and So On
Hadith #11.arabicText: 11ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ يَحْتَجِمَ الرَّجُلُ وَهُوَ جُنُبٌ.
Hadith #11.englishText: 11. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘It is permissible for one who has experienced sexual relation to draw blood from his body by means of cupping.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/151)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One after Carnal Relation Sweats in His Clothes, Clothes Touch His Wet Body
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنْ أَبِي أُسَامَةَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ الْجُنُبِ يَعْرَقُ فِي ثَوْبِهِ أَوْ يَغْتَسِلُ فَيُعَانِقُ امْرَأَتَهُ وَيُضَاجِعُهَا وَهِيَ حَائِضٌ أَوْ جُنُبٌ فَيُصِيبُ جَسَدُهُ مِنْ عَرَقِهَا قَالَ هَذَا كُلُّهُ لَيْسَ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from ibn ’Udhaynah from abu ‘Usamah who has said the following: “I once asked abu ’Abd Allah , about one who has experienced sexual relation who perspires in his clothes or takes Ghusl (bath), then hugs his wife or sleeps next to her during her Hayd (menses) or has experienced sexual relation and her perspiration touches his body. He (the Imam) said, ‘All of such things are not harmful.”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/152)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One after Carnal Relation Sweats in His Clothes, Clothes Touch His Wet Body
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ عَنْ أَبِي أُسَامَةَ قَالَ قُلْتُ لأَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) يُصِيبُنِي السَّمَاءُ وَعَلَيَّ ثَوْبٌ فَتَبُلُّهُ وَأَنَا جُنُبٌ فَيُصِيبُ بَعْضَ مَا أَصَابَ جَسَدِي مِنَ الْمَنِيِّ أَ فَأُصَلِّي فِيهِ قَالَ نَعَمْ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Jamil ibn Darraj from abu ‘Usamah who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about my exposure in the open, under the sky because of which my clothes become wet, while I have experienced sexual relation, and such clothes reach the part of my body which is polluted with semen, can I perform Salah (prayer) in such clothes? He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, you can do so.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/153)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One after Carnal Relation Sweats in His Clothes, Clothes Touch His Wet Body
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي أُسَامَةَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ الثَّوْبِ تَكُونُ فِيهِ الْجَنَابَةُ فَتُصِيبُنِي السَّمَاءُ حَتَّى يَبْتَلَّ عَلَيَّ قَالَ لاَ بَأْسَ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Muhammad ibn Ahmad has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Faddal from ibn Bukayr from abu ‘Usamah who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about clothes in which one has experienced sexual relation and then under the open sky it becomes wet with dew. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/154)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #6.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One after Carnal Relation Sweats in His Clothes, Clothes Touch His Wet Body
Hadith #6.arabicText: 6ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لأَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) الرَّجُلُ يَبُولُ وَهُوَ جُنُبٌ ثُمَّ يَسْتَنْجِي فَيُصِيبُ ثَوْبُهُ جَسَدَهُ وَهُوَ رَطْبٌ قَالَ لاَ بَأْسَ.
Hadith #6.englishText: 6. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about a man who urinates while he has experienced sexual relation. He then cleanses himself and his clothes touch his body while it is wet. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/154)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Semen or Al-Madhiy Comes in Contact with One’s Clothes or Body
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ مُيَسِّرٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لأَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) آمُرُ الْجَارِيَةَ فَتَغْسِلُ ثَوْبِي مِنَ الْمَنِيِّ فَلاَ تُبَالِغُ غَسْلَهُ فَأُصَلِّي فِيهِ فَإِذَا هُوَ يَابِسٌ قَالَ أَعِدْ صَلاَتَكَ أَمَّا إِنَّكَ لَوْ كُنْتَ غَسَلْتَ أَنْتَ لَمْ يَكُنْ عَلَيْكَ شَيْ‏ءٌ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Um ay r from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar from Muyassir who has said the following: “I once said to abu ‘Abd Allah , ‘I instruct the slave-girl to wash my clothes because of semen, but she does not pay proper attention to washing and I perform Salah (prayer) in them and it (semen) is dry. He (the Imam) said, ‘You must do your Salah (prayer) again. Had you yourself washed it, you would not have been required to perform your Salah (prayer) again.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/155)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Semen or Al-Madhiy Comes in Contact with One’s Clothes or Body
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الْمَنِيِّ يُصِيبُ الثَّوْبَ قَالَ اغْسِلِ الثَّوْبَ كُلَّهُ إِذَا خَفِيَ عَلَيْكَ مَكَانُهُ قَلِيلاً كَانَ أَوْ كَثِيراً.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ‘Uthman ibn ‘Isa from Sama‘ah who has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam) , about the case of semen that pollutes one’s clothes. He (the Imam) said, ‘You must wash all of your clothes when you do not know exactly the polluted spot, regardless, if it is a little or large area.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/155)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Semen or Al-Madhiy Comes in Contact with One’s Clothes or Body
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ إِذَا احْتَلَمَ الرَّجُلُ فَأَصَابَ ثَوْبَهُ شَيْ‏ءٌ فَلْيَغْسِلِ الَّذِي أَصَابَهُ وَإِنْ ظَنَّ أَنَّهُ أَصَابَهُ شَيْ‏ءٌ وَلَمْ يَسْتَيْقِنْ وَلَمْ يَرَ مَكَانَهُ فَلْيَنْضَحْهُ بِالْمَاءِ وَإِنْ يَسْتَيْقِنْ أَنَّهُ قَدْ أَصَابَهُ وَلَمْ يَرَ مَكَانَهُ فَلْيَغْسِلْ ثَوْبَهُ كُلَّهُ فَإِنَّهُ أَحْسَنُ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘If a man experiences wet dream and his clothes come in contact with semen, he must wash the polluted area. If he thinks, but is not certain and has not seen the polluted area, he must pour water on it. If he is certain that semen has come in contact with his clothes but he has not seen the polluted spot, he must wash all of his clothes; it is better.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/155)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine Comes in Contact with One’s Clothes or Body
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ أَبِي الْعَلاَءِ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ الْبَوْلِ يُصِيبُ الْجَسَدَ قَالَ صُبَّ عَلَيْهِ الْمَاءَ مَرَّتَيْنِ فَإِنَّمَا هُوَ مَاءٌ وَسَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الثَّوْبِ يُصِيبُهُ الْبَوْلُ قَالَ اغْسِلْهُ مَرَّتَيْنِ وَسَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الصَّبِيِّ يَبُولُ عَلَى الثَّوْبِ قَالَ يَصُبُّ عَلَيْهِ الْمَاءَ قَلِيلاً ثُمَّ يَعْصِرُهُ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from al-Husayn ibn abu al-‘Ala’ who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about urine that pollutes one’s body. He (the Imam) said, Tour water on it twice; it is water.’ I then asked about urine, which pollutes one’s clothes. He (the Imam) said, ‘Wash it twice.’ I then asked him about the urine of a child that pollutes one’s clothes. He (the Imam) said, ‘After pouring a small amount of water on it you must also wring it.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/156)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine Comes in Contact with One’s Clothes or Body
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ أَبِي مَحْمُودٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِلرِّضَا (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) الطِّنْفِسَةُ وَالْفِرَاشُ يُصِيبُهُمَا الْبَوْلُ كَيْفَ يُصْنَعُ بِهِمَا وَهُوَ ثَخِينٌ كَثِيرُ الْحَشْوِ قَالَ يُغْسَلُ مَا ظَهَرَ مِنْهُ فِي وَجْهِهِ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from Ibrahim ibn abu Mahmud who has said the following: “I once asked al-Rida , about how one should deal with velvet-like carpet and the beds that come in contact with urine, which are thick and bulky. He (the Imam) said, ‘Whatever is on the surface of such items must be washed clean.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/157)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine Comes in Contact with One’s Clothes or Body
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ أَحْمَدُ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ الْقَاسِمِ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْحَمِيدِ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ الثَّوْبِ يُصِيبُهُ الْبَوْلُ فَيَنْفُذُ إِلَى الْجَانِبِ الآخَرِ وَعَنِ الْفَرْوِ وَمَا فِيهِ مِنَ الْحَشْوِ قَالَ اغْسِلْ مَا أَصَابَ مِنْهُ وَمَسَّ الْجَانِبَ الآخَرَ فَإِنْ أَصَبْتَ مَسَّ شَيْ‏ءٍ مِنْهُ فَاغْسِلْهُ وَإِلاَّ فَانْضَحْهُ بِالْمَاءِ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Ahmad ibn Musa has narrated from al-Qasim from Ibrahim ibn ‘Abd al-Hamid who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan , about clothes that come in contact with urine and it passes to the other side through its fillings. He (the Imam) said, ‘You must wash the polluted area, feel the other side and wash it clean, if you found something; otherwise, pour water on it to wash it clean.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/158)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine Comes in Contact with One’s Clothes or Body
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ حَكَمِ بْنِ حُكَيْمٍ الصَّيْرَفِيِّ قَالَ قُلْتُ لأَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) أَبُولُ فَلاَ أُصِيبُ الْمَاءَ وَقَدْ أَصَابَ يَدِي شَيْ‏ءٌ مِنَ الْبَوْلِ فَأَمْسَحُهُ بِالْحَائِطِ أَوِ التُّرَابِ ثُمَّ تَعْرَقُ يَدِي فَأَمْسَحُ وَجْهِي أَوْ بَعْضَ جَسَدِي أَوْ يُصِيبُ ثَوْبِي قَالَ لاَ بَأْسَ بِهِ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Hisham ibn Salim from Hakam ibn Hukaym al-Sayrafiy who has said the following: “I once said to abu ‘Abd Allah , ‘I may urinate but do not find water, my hands have come in contact with urine and I wipe it against the wall or soil. Then it perspires and I wipe my face with it or other parts of my body or my clothes. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/158)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine Comes in Contact with One’s Clothes or Body
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ أَنَّهُ قَالَ فِي كِتَابِ سَمَاعَةَ رَفَعَهُ إِلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) إِنْ أَصَابَ الثَّوْبَ شَيْ‏ءٌ مِنْ بَوْلِ السِّنَّوْرِ فَلاَ تَصِحُّ الصَّلاَةُ فِيهِ حَتَّى تَغْسِلَهُ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah who has said that it is in the book of Sama‘ah who in a marfu‘ manner has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘If clothes come in contact with the urine of cats, performing Salah (prayer) with such clothes is not valid until they are washed.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/159)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #6.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine Comes in Contact with One’s Clothes or Body
Hadith #6.arabicText: 6ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنْ بَوْلِ الصَّبِيِّ قَالَ تَصُبُّ عَلَيْهِ الْمَاءَ وَإِنْ كَانَ قَدْ أَكَلَ فَاغْسِلْهُ غَسْلاً وَالْغُلاَمُ وَالْجَارِيَةُ فِي ذَلِكَ شَرَعٌ سَوَاءٌ.
Hadith #6.englishText: 6. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about the urine of a child. He (the Imam) said, ‘You must just pour water on it but if the child eats food, wash it clean, and a baby boy or baby girl are the same.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/159)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine of Animals and Their Dung
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ أَنَّهُمَا قَالاَ لاَ تَغْسِلْ ثَوْبَكَ مِنْ بَوْلِ شَيْ‏ءٍ يُؤْكَلُ لَحْمُهُ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from Hariz from Zurarah who has said the following: “The two Imam , have said, ‘It is not necessary for you to wash your clothes because of urine of the edible animals.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/160)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine of Animals and Their Dung
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ حَمَّادٌ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنْ أَلْبَانِ الإِبِلِ وَالْغَنَمِ وَالْبَقَرِ وَأَبْوَالِهَا وَلُحُومِهَا فَقَالَ لاَ تَوَضَّأْ مِنْهُ إِنْ أَصَابَكَ مِنْهُ شَيْ‏ءٌ أَوْ ثَوْباً لَكَ فَلاَ تَغْسِلْهُ إِلاَّ أَنْ تَتَنَظَّفَ قَالَ وَسَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ أَبْوَالِ الدَّوَابِّ وَالْبِغَالِ وَالْحَمِيرِ فَقَالَ اغْسِلْهُ فَإِنْ لَمْ تَعْلَمْ مَكَانَهُ فَاغْسِلِ الثَّوْبَ كُلَّهُ وَإِنْ شَكَكْتَ فَانْضَحْهُ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Hammad has narrated from Hariz from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I once asked abu ’Abd Allah , about the milk of camels, sheep and cows and their urine and their meat. He (the Imam) said, ‘You must not take Wudu’ with the water which is mixed with any of such items. You do not need to wash if your clothes come in contact with such items unless it is for removing stains.’ He (the narrator) said that I then asked about the urine of animals, such as mules and donkeys. He (the Imam) said, ‘You must wash it clean but if you do not know the polluted area, wash all of the clothes, and if you have doubts then just pour water to wash it clean.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/161)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine of Animals and Their Dung
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) اغْسِلْ ثَوْبَكَ مِنْ أَبْوَالِ مَا لاَ يُؤْكَلُ لَحْمُهُ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘Wash your clothes because of the urine of inedible animals.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/161)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #6.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine of Animals and Their Dung
Hadith #6.arabicText: 6ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْبَرْقِيِّ عَنْ أَبَانٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ لاَ بَأْسَ بِرَوْثِ الْحَمِيرِ وَاغْسِلْ أَبْوَالَهَا.
Hadith #6.englishText: 6. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Barqiy from Aban from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘Dung of donkeys is not harmful but you must wash clean their urine.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/162)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #8.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine of Animals and Their Dung
Hadith #8.arabicText: 8ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ إِنْ أَصَابَ الثَّوْبَ شَيْ‏ءٌ مِنْ بَوْلِ السِّنَّوْرِ فَلاَ يَصْلُحُ الصَّلاَةُ فِيهِ حَتَّى تَغْسِلَهُ.
Hadith #8.englishText: 8. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah from Sama‘ah who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘It is not proper to perform Salah (prayer) with clothes that have come in contact with the urine of cat.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/162)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #9.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Urine of Animals and Their Dung
Hadith #9.arabicText: 9ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ جَمِيلِ بْنِ دَرَّاجٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ كُلُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ يَطِيرُ فَلاَ بَأْسَ بِبَوْلِهِ وَخُرْئِهِ.
Hadith #9.englishText: 9. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ’Abd Allah ibn af-Mughirah from Jamil ibn Darraj from abu Basir who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘Urine and droppings of the things that fly are not harmful.”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/162)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Clothes Come in Contact with Blood and Pus
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ حُكَيْمٍ عَنِ الْمُعَلَّى أَبِي عُثْمَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) وَهُوَ يُصَلِّي فَقَالَ لِي قَائِدِي إِنَّ فِي ثَوْبِهِ دَماً فَلَمَّا انْصَرَفَ قُلْتُ لَهُ إِنَّ قَائِدِي أَخْبَرَنِي أَنَّ بِثَوْبِكَ دَماً فَقَالَ لِي إِنَّ بِي دَمَامِيلَ وَلَسْتُ أَغْسِلُ ثَوْبِي حَتَّى تَبْرَأَ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Mu‘awiyah ibn al-Hukaym from al-Mu‘alla’ abu ‘Uthman from abu Basir who has said the following: “I once visited abu Ja’far , when he was performing Salah (prayer). My guide informed me that there was blood on the clothes of the Imam. When he completed his Salah (prayer), I said that my guide has told me that there is blood on your clothes. He (the Imam) said, ‘I have pimples and I did not want to wash my clothes until they are cured.”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/163)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Clothes Come in Contact with Blood and Pus
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ أَحْمَدُ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الرَّجُلِ بِهِ الْقَرْحُ أَوِ الْجُرْحُ وَلاَ يَسْتَطِيعُ أَنْ يَرْبِطَهُ وَلاَ يَغْسِلَ دَمَهُ قَالَ يُصَلِّي وَلاَ يَغْسِلُ ثَوْبَهُ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ إِلاَّ مَرَّةً فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَسْتَطِيعُ أَنْ يَغْسِلَ ثَوْبَهُ كُلَّ سَاعَةٍ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Ahmad has narrated from ‘Uthman ibn ‘Isa from Sama‘ah who has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam) , about a man on whose body there are sores or wounds which he cannot bandage or wash the blood. He (the Imam) said, ‘He can perform his Salah (prayer) without washing his clothes except once a day; he cannot wash his clothes every hour.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/164)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Clothes Come in Contact with Blood and Pus
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ الدَّمُ يَكُونُ فِي الثَّوْبِ عَلَيَّ وَأَنَا فِي الصَّلاَةِ قَالَ إِنْ رَأَيْتَ وَعَلَيْكَ ثَوْبٌ غَيْرُهُ فَاطْرَحْهُ وَصَلِّ وَإِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ عَلَيْكَ غَيْرُهُ فَامْضِ فِي صَلاَتِكَ وَلاَ إِعَادَةَ عَلَيْكَ مَا لَمْ يَزِدْ عَلَى مِقْدَارِ الدِّرْهَمِ وَمَا كَانَ أَقَلَّ مِنْ ذَلِكَ فَلَيْسَ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ رَأَيْتَهُ قَبْلُ أَوْ لَمْ تَرَهُ وَإِذَا كُنْتَ قَدْ رَأَيْتَهُ وَهُوَ أَكْثَرُ مِنْ مِقْدَارِ الدِّرْهَمِ فَضَيَّعْتَ غَسْلَهُ وَصَلَّيْتَ فِيهِ صَلاَةً كَثِيرَةً فَأَعِدْ مَا صَلَّيْتَ فِيهِ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father, from Hammad, from Hariz, from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I once said to him (the Imam), ‘I may find blood on my clothes when I am performing Salah (prayer).’ He (the Imam) said, ‘If you find blood and you have other clothes on you, you must remove it and complete your Salah (prayer). However, if you do not have other clothes on you besides that one, you must complete your Salah (prayer). You do not have to perform that Salah (prayer) again if the area covered by that blood is not more than the size of a dirham, and an area of smaller size does not matter, regardless if you have seen it before or not. If you have seen it before and it is bigger than the size of a dirham, but you have missed to wash it and have performed with it many Salah (prayer), you must perform again the Salah (prayers) you have performed with it.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/164)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Clothes Come in Contact with Blood and Pus
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ مُصَدِّقِ بْنِ صَدَقَةَ عَنْ عَمَّارٍ السَّابَاطِيِّ قَالَ سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنْ رَجُلٍ يَسِيلُ مِنْ أَنْفِهِ الدَّمُ هَلْ عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يَغْسِلَ بَاطِنَهُ يَعْنِي جَوْفَ الأنْفِ فَقَالَ إِنَّمَا عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يَغْسِلَ مَا ظَهَرَ مِنْهُ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Ahmad ibn Idris has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad from Ahmad ibn al-Hassan ibn Ali from ‘Amr ibn Sa‘id from Musaddiq ibn Sadaqah from ‘Ammar al-Sabatiy who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , was asked about a man from whose nostril blood flows. ‘Is he required to wash inside of his nostril?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘He only needs to wash what is apparent.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/165)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Dogs Touching Clothes, Body and So On
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ حَمَّادُ بْنُ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ الْكَلْبِ يُصِيبُ شَيْئاً مِنْ جَسَدِ الرَّجُلِ قَالَ يَغْسِلُ الْمَكَانَ الَّذِي أَصَابَهُ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Hammad ibn ‘Isa has narrated from Hariz from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about a man whose body is polluted because of a dog. He (the Imam) said, ‘He must wash clean the area which has come in contact with a dog.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/169)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Dogs Touching Clothes, Body and So On
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنِ الْعَمْرَكِيِّ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ النَّيْسَابُورِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَخِيهِ مُوسَى (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الْفَأْرَةِ الرَّطْبَةِ قَدْ وَقَعَتْ فِي الْمَاءِ تَمْشِي عَلَى الثِّيَابِ أَ يُصَلَّى فِيهَا قَالَ اغْسِلْ مَا رَأَيْتَ مِنْ أَثَرِهَا وَمَا لَمْ تَرَهُ فَانْضَحْهُ بِالْمَاءِ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from al-‘Amrakiy ibn Ali al-Naysaburiy from Ali ibn Ja‘far from his brother, Musa , has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam) , about a mouse that has fallen in water and then walks on clothes. Can one perform Salah (prayer) in such clothes? He (the Imam) said, ‘Wash to clean the marks that you find and what you do not find just pour water on them.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/169)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #6.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Dogs Touching Clothes, Body and So On
Hadith #6.arabicText: 6ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنِ الْعَمْرَكِيِّ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يُصِيبُ ثَوْبَهُ خِنْزِيرٌ فَلَمْ يَغْسِلْهُ فَذَكَرَ ذَلِكَ وَهُوَ فِي صَلاَتِهِ كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ قَالَ إِنْ كَانَ دَخَلَ فِي صَلاَتِهِ فَلْيَمْضِ وَإِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ دَخَلَ فِي صَلاَتِهِ فَلْيَنْضَحْ مَا أَصَابَ مِنْ ثَوْبِهِ إِلاَّ أَنْ يَكُونَ فِيهِ أَثَرٌ فَيَغْسِلُهُ.
Hadith #6.englishText: 6. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from al-‘Amrakiy ibn Ali from Ali ibn Ja‘far from Musa ibn Ja‘far , who has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam) , about a man whose clothes come in contact with pigs which he forgets to wash, but he remembers it when he is performing Salah (prayer), what he must do. He (the Imam) said, ‘If he has already begun his Salah (prayer) he must continue; but if he has not yet began his Salah (prayer), he must pour water on the area which has come in contact with the pig. If there are marks on such clothes, then one must wash them clean.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/171)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Description of Tayammum
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَعَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ سَهْلٍ جَمِيعاً عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنِ ابْنِ بُكَيْرٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ التَّيَمُّمِ فَضَرَبَ بِيَدِهِ الأرْضَ ثُمَّ رَفَعَهَا فَنَفَضَهَا ثُمَّ مَسَحَ بِهَا جَبِينَيْهِ وَكَفَّيْهِ مَرَّةً وَاحِدَةً.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father and Afi ibn Muhammad from Sahl all from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn abu Nasr from ibn Bukayr from Zurarah who has said the following: “I once asked Abu Ja‘far , about Tayammum. He (the Imam) thumped his hands on the ground then raised them, and allowed loose soil to fall off them. He (the Imam) then wiped both (sections of) his forehead (the parts above both eyebrows) and (the back of) his palms (hands) only once.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/171)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Description of Tayammum
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنِ الْكَاهِلِيِّ قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ التَّيَمُّمِ قَالَ فَضَرَبَ بِيَدِهِ عَلَى الْبِسَاطِ فَمَسَحَ بِهَا وَجْهَهُ ثُمَّ مَسَحَ كَفَّيْهِ إِحْدَاهُمَا عَلَى ظَهْرِ الأخْرَى.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Safwan from al-Kahiliy who has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam) about Tayammum. He (the Imam) , thumped his hand on the furnishing, then wiped with it his face and then the backs of his both hands one with the other.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/173)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Description of Tayammum
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ التَّيَمُّمِ فَقَالَ إِنَّ عَمَّارَ بْنَ يَاسِرٍ أَصَابَتْهُ جَنَابَةٌ فَتَمَعَّكَ كَمَا تَتَمَعَّكُ الدَّابَّةُ فَقَالَ لَهُ رَسُولُ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) يَا عَمَّارُ تَمَعَّكْتَ كَمَا تَتَمَعَّكُ الدَّابَّةُ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ كَيْفَ التَّيَمُّمُ فَوَضَعَ يَدَهُ عَلَى الْمِسْحِ ثُمَّ رَفَعَهَا فَمَسَحَ وَجْهَهُ ثُمَّ مَسَحَ فَوْقَ الْكَفِّ قَلِيلاً. وَرَوَاهُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus from ibn abu Ayyub al-Khazzaz who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about Tayammum. He (the Imam) said, “Ammar ibn Yasir once had experienced sexual relation and he rolled himself on the ground as certain animals do. The Messenger of Allah said, ‘O ‘Ammar, you rolled yourself on the ground as certain animals do.’ I (the narrator) then asked him (the Imam), ‘How is Tayammum done?’ He (the Imam) placed his hand on the sackcloth, then raised it and wiped his face, then the backs of his hands slightly.” He (the narrator) has narrated it (the previous Hadith) from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from abu Ayyub also.

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/174)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: When Tayammum Is Necessary and Finding Water Thereafter
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنِ الْعَلاَءِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ إِذَا لَمْ تَجِدْ مَاءً وَأَرَدْتَ التَّيَمُّمَ فَأَخِّرِ التَّيَمُّمَ إِلَى آخِرِ الْوَقْتِ فَإِنْ فَاتَكَ الْمَاءُ لَمْ تَفُتْكَ الأرْضُ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Safwan from al-‘Ala’ from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I heard him (the Imam) , say, ‘If you cannot find water and you decide for Tayammum, you must wait until the time (for Salah (prayer)) is about to end. If water is still not available, you do not miss the soil and the ground.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/175)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: When Tayammum Is Necessary and Finding Water Thereafter
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَحَدِهِمَا (عَلَيْهِما الْسَّلام) قَالَ إِذَا لَمْ يَجِدِ الْمُسَافِرُ الْمَاءَ فَلْيَطْلُبْ مَا دَامَ فِي الْوَقْتِ فَإِذَا خَافَ أَنْ يَفُوتَهُ الْوَقْتُ فَلْيَتَيَمَّمْ وَلْيُصَلِّ فِي آخِرِ الْوَقْتِ فَإِذَا وَجَدَ الْمَاءَ فَلاَ قَضَاءَ عَلَيْهِ وَلْيَتَوَضَّأْ لِمَا يَسْتَقْبِلُ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from ibn ’Udhaynah from Zurarah who has said the following: “One of the two Imam, ‘Alayhim al-Salam, has said, ‘If during a journey water cannot be found, one must search for water as long as there is time; but when there is fear for losing time, one must then take Tayammum to perform Salah (prayer) during the end of time just before it totally ends. If later water is found, then one is not required to perform Salah (prayer) again; however, Wudu’ is necessary for future.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/176)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: When Tayammum Is Necessary and Finding Water Thereafter
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) يَقُولُ إِذَا لَمْ يَجِدِ الرَّجُلُ طَهُوراً وَكَانَ جُنُباً فَلْيَمْسَحْ مِنَ الأرْضِ وَيُصَلِّي فَإِذَا وَجَدَ مَاءً فَلْيَغْتَسِلْ وَقَدْ أَجْزَأَتْهُ صَلاَتُهُ الَّتِي صَلَّى.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “I once heard abu ‘Abd Allah , say, ‘If means of cleansing (water for Ghusl (bath)) cannot be found after experiencing sexual relation, one must wipe one’s face with (soil for Tayammum) earth, then perform Salah (prayer). When water is found, Ghusl (bath) must be taken and Salah (prayer) so performed is sufficient.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/176)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: When Tayammum Is Necessary and Finding Water Thereafter
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ وَعَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ جَمِيعاً عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ قَالَ قُلْتُ لأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) يُصَلِّي الرَّجُلُ بِوُضُوءٍ وَاحِدٍ صَلاَةَ اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ كُلَّهَا قَالَ نَعَمْ مَا لَمْ يُحْدِثْ قُلْتُ فَيُصَلِّي بِتَيَمُّمٍ وَاحِدٍ صَلاَةَ اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ كُلَّهَا قَالَ نَعَمْ مَا لَمْ يُحْدِثْ أَوْ يُصِبْ مَاءً قُلْتُ فَإِنْ أَصَابَ الْمَاءَ وَرَجَا أَنْ يَقْدِرَ عَلَى مَاءٍ آخَرَ وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ يَقْدِرُ عَلَيْهِ كُلَّمَا أَرَادَ فَعَسُرَ ذَلِكَ عَلَيْهِ قَالَ يَنْقُضُ ذَلِكَ تَيَمُّمَهُ وَعَلَيْهِ أَنْ يُعِيدَ التَّيَمُّمَ قُلْتُ فَإِنْ أَصَابَ الْمَاءَ وَقَدْ دَخَلَ فِي الصَّلاَةِ قَالَ فَلْيَنْصَرِفْ وَلْيَتَوَضَّأْ مَا لَمْ يَرْكَعْ فَإِنْ كَانَ قَدْ رَكَعَ فَلْيَمْضِ فِي صَلاَتِهِ فَإِنَّ التَّيَمُّمَ أَحَدُ الطَّهُورَيْنِ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan and Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father all from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from Hariz from Zurarah who has said the following: “I once asked abu Ja‘far , ‘Can one perform with a single Wudu’ the Salah (prayer) of a whole day and night? He (the Imam) said, ‘It is permissible as long as one has a valid Wudu’.’ I then asked, ‘Is it permissible in the case of one Tayammum also? He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, it is permissible as long as one has a valid Wudu’ and still has not found water.’ I then asked, ‘What is one’s duty if water is found or has hopes to be able to find other water and has a greater hope to find water when one would want but it then becomes difficult?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘In such case Wudu’ becomes invalid therefore; Tayammum must be taken again.’ I then asked, ‘What is the obligation if water is found when one is performing Salah (prayer)?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It must be discontinued to take Wudu’ if one has not yet assumed the position of Ruku‘; once already in the position of Ruku‘, Salah (prayer) must be continued; Tayammum is one of the two forms of Taharat (cleansing).”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/176)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #7.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: When Tayammum Is Necessary and Finding Water Thereafter
Hadith #7.arabicText: 7ـ أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ أَبِي الْعَلاَءِ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يَمُرُّ بِالرَّكِيَّةِ وَلَيْسَ مَعَهُ دَلْوٌ قَالَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يَنْزِلَ الرَّكِيَّةَ إِنَّ رَبَّ الْمَاءِ هُوَ رَبُّ الأرْضِ فَلْيَتَيَمَّمْ.
Hadith #7.englishText: 7. Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from Ali ibn al-Hakam from al-Husayn ibn abu af-‘Afa’ who has said the foflowing: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about a man who passes by a well but does not have a bucket (to draw water). He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not necessary for him to climb down the well; the Lord of water is the Lord the earth; he must take Tayammum.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/179)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #10.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: When Tayammum Is Necessary and Finding Water Thereafter
Hadith #10.arabicText: 10ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ ابْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ كَانَ فِي سَفَرٍ وَكَانَ مَعَهُ مَاءٌ فَنَسِيَهُ وَتَيَمَّمَ وَصَلَّى ثُمَّ ذَكَرَ أَنَّ مَعَهُ مَاءً قَبْلَ أَنْ يَخْرُجَ الْوَقْتُ قَالَ عَلَيْهِ أَنْ يَتَوَضَّأَ وَيُعِيدَ الصَّلاَةَ قَالَ وَسَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ تَيَمُّمِ الْحَائِضِ وَالْجُنُبِ سَوَاءٌ إِذَا لَمْ يَجِدَا مَاءً قَالَ نَعَمْ.
Hadith #10.englishText: 10. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ‘Uthman ibn ‘Isa from ibn Muskan from abu Basir who has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam) , about a man who during a journey had a certain amount of water but forgot all about it, and with Tayammum performed Salah (prayer). Then he remembered that there was water with him and still there is time for Salah (prayer). He (the Imam) said, ‘He must take Wudu’ and perform Salah (prayer) again.’ I (the narrator) then asked him (the Imam) if Tayammum for one experiencing Hayd (menses) and sexual relation who cannot find water is the same. He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, it is the same.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/180)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One’s having Little Water on a Journey but Is Afraid of Facing Thirst
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنِ ابْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) فِي رَجُلٍ أَصَابَتْهُ جَنَابَةٌ فِي السَّفَرِ وَلَيْسَ مَعَهُ مَاءٌ إِلاَّ قَلِيلٌ وَخَافَ إِنْ هُوَ اغْتَسَلَ أَنْ يَعْطَشَ قَالَ إِنْ خَافَ عَطَشاً فَلاَ يُهَرِيقُ مِنْهُ قَطْرَةً وَلْيَتَيَمَّمْ بِالصَّعِيدِ فَإِنَّ الصَّعِيدَ أَحَبُّ إِلَيَّ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ’Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah from ibn Sinan who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about a man who, during a journey, experiences sexual relation but does not have any water with him except very little and is afraid of facing thirst if it is used for Ghusl (bath). He (the Imam) said, ‘If he is afraid of facing thirst, he must spill not even one drop; he must take Tayammum with soil; soil is more dear to me”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/181)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One’s having Little Water on a Journey but Is Afraid of Facing Thirst
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ حُمْرَانَ وَجَمِيلٍ قَالاَ قُلْنَا لأَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) إِمَامُ قَوْمٍ أَصَابَتْهُ جَنَابَةٌ فِي السَّفَرِ وَلَيْسَ مَعَهُ مَاءٌ يَكْفِيهِ لِلْغُسْلِ أَ يَتَوَضَّأُ بَعْضُهُمْ وَيُصَلِّي بِهِمْ قَالَ لاَ وَلَكِنْ يَتَيَمَّمُ وَيُصَلِّي بِهِمْ فَإِنَّ الله عَزَّ وَجَلَّ قَدْ جَعَلَ التُّرَابَ طَهُوراً.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Muhammad ibn Humran and Jamil who have said the following: “Once we asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about the case of the Imam of a people during a journey who experiences sexual relation and does not have enough water for Ghusl (bath). Can another person from among them take Wudu’ and lead them in Salah (prayer)? He (the Imam) said, ‘No, they cannot do so; however, he must take Tayammum and lead them in Salah (prayer); Allah, most Majestic, most Glorious, has made the soil purifying.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/182)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One’s having Little Water on a Journey but Is Afraid of Facing Thirst
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ قَالَ إِنْ كَانَتِ الأرْضُ مُبْتَلَّةً وَلَيْسَ فِيهَا تُرَابٌ وَلاَ مَاءٌ فَانْظُرْ أَجَفَّ مَوْضِعٍ تَجِدُهُ فَتَيَمَّمْ مِنْ غُبَارِهِ أَوْ شَيْ‏ءٍ مُغْبَرٍّ وَإِنْ كَانَ فِي حَالٍ لاَ تَجِدُ إِلاَّ الطِّينَ فَلاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ تَتَيَمَّمَ بِهِ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah who has said the following: “(Abu ‘Abd Allah  ) has said, ‘If the ground is wet and dry soil or water is not available you must look for an area which is the most dry of the others, take Tayammum with dust thereof or something with dust on it. If you can find nothing else other than clay, then it is not harmful to take Tayammum therewith.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/182)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: One’s Experiencing Carnal Relations and Having Only Ice
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَمُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ جَمِيعاً عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ أَجْنَبَ فِي السَّفَرِ وَلَمْ يَجِدْ إِلاَّ الثَّلْجَ أَوْ مَاءً جَامِداً فَقَالَ هُوَ بِمَنْزِلَةِ الضَّرُورَةِ يَتَيَمَّمُ وَلاَ أَرَى أَنْ يَعُودَ إِلَى هَذِهِ الأرْضِ الَّتِي تُوبِقُ دِينَهُ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father and Muhammad ibn Yahya from Ahmad ibn Muhammad all from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from Hariz from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I once asked abu ’Abd Allah , about a man who experiences sexual relation during a journey and cannot find anything other than snow or ice. He (the Imam) said, ’This is like an emergency case and he must take Tayammum. I do not consider it proper for him to return to such land which ruins his religion.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/183)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Bandages, Injuries, One’s Suffering from Smallpox and or Experiencing Carnal Relations
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يَكُونُ بِهِ الْقَرْحُ وَالْجِرَاحَةُ يُجْنِبُ قَالَ لاَ بَأْسَ بِأَنْ لاَ يَغْتَسِلَ وَيَتَيَمَّمَ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Mahbub from abu Ayyub al-Khazzaz from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I once asked Abu Ja‘far , about a man on whose body there are dimples or wounds and experiences sexual relation. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful if one does not take Ghusl (bath) in such condition, instead takes Tayammum.’’’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/186)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Bandages, Injuries, One’s Suffering from Smallpox and or Experiencing Carnal Relations
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ قَالَ يَتَيَمَّمُ الْمَجْدُورُ وَالْكَسِيرُ بِالتُّرَابِ إِذَا أَصَابَتْهُ الْجَنَابَةُ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from certain persons of his people who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘One with smallpox or broken bones has permission to take Tayammum with soil after experiencing sexual relation.”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/186)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Bandages, Injuries, One’s Suffering from Smallpox and or Experiencing Carnal Relations
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سُكَيْنٍ وَغَيْرِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ قِيلَ لَهُ إِنَّ فُلاَناً أَصَابَتْهُ جَنَابَةٌ وَهُوَ مَجْدُورٌ فَغَسَّلُوهُ فَمَاتَ فَقَالَ قَتَلُوهُ أَلاَّ سَأَلُوا أَلاَّ يَمَّمُوهُ إِنَّ شِفَاءَ الْعِيِّ السُّؤَالُ قَالَ وَرُوِيَ ذَلِكَ فِي الْكَسِيرِ وَالْمَبْطُونِ يَتَيَمَّمُ وَلاَ يَغْتَسِلُ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Muhammad ibn Sukayn and others who has said the following: “It was said to abu ‘Abd Allah , that so and so had smallpox and had experienced sexual relation. They gave him Ghusl (bath) which caused him to die. He (the Imam) said, ‘They killed him. Why did they not ask about giving him Tayammum? Only asking is medicine for ignorance.’” It applies also to one with broken bones and internal illness (causing discharge from the buttocks) who must do Tayammum instead of Ghusl (bath).

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/187)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #7.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Rare Ahadith about Wudu’
Hadith #7.arabicText: 7ـ عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنِ ابْنِ رِئَابٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ قَيْسٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) يَقُولُ وَهُوَ يُحَدِّثُ النَّاسَ بِمَكَّةَ صَلَّى رَسُولُ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) الْفَجْرَ ثُمَّ جَلَسَ مَعَ أَصْحَابِهِ حَتَّى طَلَعَتِ الشَّمْسُ فَجَعَلَ يَقُومُ الرَّجُلُ بَعْدَ الرَّجُلِ حَتَّى لَمْ يَبْقَ مَعَهُ إِلاَّ رَجُلاَنِ أَنْصَارِيٌّ وَثَقَفِيٌّ فَقَالَ لَهُمَا رَسُولُ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) قَدْ عَلِمْتُ أَنَّ لَكُمَا حَاجَةً وَتُرِيدَانِ أَنْ تَسْأَلاَ عَنْهَا فَإِنْ شِئْتُمَا أَخْبَرْتُكُمَا بِحَاجَتِكُمَا قَبْلَ أَنْ تَسْأَلاَنِي وَإِنْ شِئْتُمَا فَاسْأَلاَ عَنْهَا قَالاَ بَلْ تُخْبِرُنَا قَبْلَ أَنْ نَسْأَلَكَ عَنْهَا فَإِنَّ ذَلِكَ أَجْلَى لِلْعَمَى وَأَبْعَدُ مِنَ الارْتِيَابِ وَأَثْبَتُ لِلإِيمَانِ فَقَالَ رَسُولُ الله (صلّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِه) أَمَّا أَنْتَ يَا أَخَا ثَقِيفٍ فَإِنَّكَ جِئْتَ أَنْ تَسْأَلَنِي عَنْ وُضُوئِكَ وَصَلاَتِكَ مَا لَكَ فِي ذَلِكَ مِنَ الْخَيْرِ أَمَّا وُضُوؤُكَ فَإِنَّكَ إِذَا وَضَعْتَ يَدَكَ فِي إِنَائِكَ ثُمَّ قُلْتَ بِسْمِ الله تَنَاثَرَتْ مِنْهَا مَا اكْتَسَبَتْ مِنَ الذُّنُوبِ فَإِذَا غَسَلْتَ وَجْهَكَ تَنَاثَرَتِ الذُّنُوبُ الَّتِي اكْتَسَبَتْهَا عَيْنَاكَ بِنَظَرِهِمَا وَفُوكَ فَإِذَا غَسَلْتَ ذِرَاعَيْكَ تَنَاثَرَتِ الذُّنُوبُ عَنْ يَمِينِكَ وَشِمَالِكَ فَإِذَا مَسَحْتَ رَأْسَكَ وَقَدَمَيْكَ تَنَاثَرَتِ الذُّنُوبُ الَّتِي مَشَيْتَ إِلَيْهَا عَلَى قَدَمَيْكَ فَهَذَا لَكَ فِي وُضُوئِكَ.
Hadith #7.englishText: 7. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Mahbub from ibn Ri’ab from Muhammad ibn Qays who has said the following: “I heard abu Ja‘far , say while speaking to people in Makkah, ‘One day the Messenger of Allah completed his Salah (prayer) of the morning and sat in the Masjid with his companions until sunrise. Thereafter, people one by one left the Masjid except two men, one from the people of Ansar and the other from Thaqif. The Messenger of Allah then said to them, “I understand you need to ask me questions. You may ask if you like and I will answer. If you like, I can tell you what your questions are before you ask. If you wish, you may ask me.” They said, “Please inform us before we ask you our questions; it is more enlightening, frees us from doubts and strengthens our belief more.” The Messenger of Allah then said, “You, gentleman from Thaqif, have come to ask me about your Wudu’ and Salah (prayer) regarding what is good for you in them. You should keep in mind that when you place your hand in your water container and say ‘In the name of Allah’ the sins that your hands may have committed scatter away from you. The sins that your eyes and mouth may have committed scatter away from you when you wash your face. When you wash your arms to your elbows, the sins from your left and right scatter away from you. When you wipe your head and feet the sins into which you may have walked scatter away from you. This is what you gain from your Wudu’.’””

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/198)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #15.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Rare Ahadith about Wudu’
Hadith #15.arabicText: 15ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ وُهَيْبِ بْنِ حَفْصٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ حَيَّةٍ دَخَلَتْ حُبّاً فِيهِ مَاءٌ وَخَرَجَتْ مِنْهُ قَالَ إِنْ وَجَدَ مَاءً غَيْرَهُ فَلْيُهَرِقْهُ.
Hadith #15.englishText: 15. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Wuhayb ibn Hafs from abu Basir who has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam) , about the case of a snake that enters in a Hub (large water container) which has water in it and then comes out. He (the Imam) said, ‘If one can find other water it should be spilled away.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/201)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #16.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Rare Ahadith about Wudu’
Hadith #16.arabicText: 16ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنِ الْعَمْرَكِيِّ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَخِيهِ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ رَعَفَ فَامْتَخَطَ فَصَارَ بَعْضُ ذَلِكَ الدَّمِ قِطَعاً صِغَاراً فَأَصَابَ إِنَاءَهُ هَلْ يَصْلُحُ لَهُ الْوُضُوءُ مِنْهُ فَقَالَ إِنْ لَمْ يَكُنْ شَيْ‏ءٌ يَسْتَبِينُ فِي الْمَاءِ فَلاَ بَأْسَ وَإِنْ كَانَ شَيْئاً بَيِّناً فَلاَ يَتَوَضَّأْ مِنْهُ قَالَ وَسَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ رَعَفَ وَهُوَ يَتَوَضَّأُ فَيَقْطُرُ قَطْرَةٌ فِي إِنَائِهِ هَلْ يَصْلُحُ الْوُضُوءُ مِنْهُ قَالَ لاَ.
Hadith #16.englishText: 16. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from al-‘Amrakiy ibn Ali from Ali ibn Ja‘far from his brother abu al-Hassan  has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan , about the case of one who had a nosebleed; then he blew his nose and parts of it became small segments which came in contact with his water container. Can he take Wudu’ with such water? He (the Imam) said, ’If nothing is visible in the water container it is not harmful. However, if things show in it he must not use it for Wudu’. 5 I (the narrator) then asked him (the Imam) about a man who has nosebleed while taking Wudu’ and a drop falls in his water container. Can he take Wudu 5 with such water? He (the Imam) said, ‘No, he cannot take Wudu’ with such water.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/201)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #17.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Rare Ahadith about Wudu’
Hadith #17.arabicText: 17ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْبَرْقِيِّ عَنْ سَعْدِ بْنِ سَعْدٍ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنْ رَجُلٍ احْتَاجَ إِلَى الْوُضُوءِ لِلصَّلاَةِ وَهُوَ لاَ يَقْدِرُ عَلَى الْمَاءِ فَوَجَدَ بِقَدْرِ مَا يَتَوَضَّأُ بِهِ بِمِائَةِ دِرْهَمٍ أَوْ بِأَلْفِ دِرْهَمٍ وَهُوَ وَاجِدٌ لَهَا يَشْتَرِي وَيَتَوَضَّأُ أَوْ يَتَيَمَّمُ قَالَ لاَ بَلْ يَشْتَرِي قَدْ أَصَابَنِي مِثْلُ ذَلِكَ فَاشْتَرَيْتُ وَتَوَضَّأْتُ وَمَا يُشْتَرَى بِذَلِكَ مَالٌ كَثِيرٌ.
Hadith #17.englishText: 17. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Barqiy from Sa‘d ibn Sa‘d from Safwan who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan , about a man who needs to take Wudu’ for Salah (prayer). However, he is not able to find water. He finds a certain amount of water which is enough for his Wudu’ but it costs one hundred dirham or one thousand dirham. He has that much dirham to buy and take Wudu’, should he buy the water or instead take Tayammum? He (the Imam) said, ‘No, he must buy. This kind of thing has happened to me and I bought water to take Wudu’. What is bought (in this case) is a great deal.’” (For such Ahadith about an act or issue of the five categories of deeds the qualities such as Wujub, (Obligatory), Hurmat (Prohibited), Istihbab (Preference), Kirahat (Detestability) or Ibahah (Permissibility) one must consult fatwas of one’s Mujtahid.)

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/201)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Chapters on Hayd (menses)
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ قَوْلِ الله عَزَّ وَجَلَّ إِنِ ارْتَبْتُمْ فَقَالَ مَا جَازَ الشَّهْرَ فَهُوَ رِيبَةٌ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about the words of Allah, most Majestic, most Glorious, ‘. . . if you doubt . . (65:4) He (the Imam) said, ‘Whatever takes place after a month is doubtful.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/203)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Minimum and Maximum Duration of Hayd
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ وَعَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ أَقَلُّ مَا يَكُونُ الْحَيْضُ ثَلاَثَةُ أَيَّامٍ وَأَكْثَرُ مَا يَكُونُ عَشَرَةُ أَيَّامٍ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan and Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father all from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘The minimum duration of Hayd (menses) is three days and its maximum is ten days.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/204)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Minimum and Maximum Duration of Hayd
Hadith #3.arabicText: 3ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ وَعَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ جَمِيعاً عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنْ أَدْنَى مَا يَكُونُ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ فَقَالَ أَدْنَاهُ ثَلاَثَةٌ وَأَبْعَدُهُ عَشَرَةٌ.
Hadith #3.englishText: 3. Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il has narrated from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan and Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father all from Safwan ibn Yahya who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan , about the minimum duration of Hayd (menses). He (the Imam) said, ‘Its minimum is three days and the longest is ten days.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/204)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Minimum and Maximum Duration of Hayd
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنِ الْعَلاَءِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ لاَ يَكُونُ الْقُرْءُ فِي أَقَلَّ مِنْ عَشَرَةِ أَيَّامٍ فَمَا زَادَ أَقَلُّ مَا يَكُونُ عَشَرَةٌ مِنْ حِينِ تَطْهُرُ إِلَى أَنْ تَرَى الدَّمَ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Safwan from al-‘Ala’ from, Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “Abu Ja‘far , has said, ‘The minimum Hayd (menses) free period is ten days, that is, the time from the end of one period of Hayd (menses) to the beginning of the second one.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/204)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Women’s Experiencing Hayd After or Before Their Date of Hayd
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ جَمِيلٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ إِذَا رَأَتِ الْمَرْأَةُ الدَّمَ قَبْلَ عَشَرَةٍ فَهُوَ مِنَ الْحَيْضَةِ الأولَى وَإِنْ كَانَ بَعْدَ الْعَشَرَةِ فَهُوَ مِنَ الْحَيْضَةِ الْمُسْتَقْبَلَةِ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Jamil from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “Abu Ja‘far , has stated this Hadith. ‘If a woman experiences blood discharge before the passing of ten days from the end of a period of her Hayd (menses), it is part of the first period of Hayd (menses); but if it is after ten days from the end of a period of her menses, it then is of her future period of her Hayd (menses).’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/207)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Women’s Experiencing Hayd After or Before Their Date of Hayd
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ عَامِرٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مَهْزِيَارَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ زُرْعَةَ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الْمَرْأَةِ تَرَى الدَّمَ قَبْلَ وَقْتِ حَيْضِهَا فَقَالَ إِذَا رَأَتِ الدَّمَ قَبْلَ وَقْتِ حَيْضِهَا فَلْتَدَعِ الصَّلاَةَ فَإِنَّهُ رُبَّمَا تَعَجَّلَ بِهَا الْوَقْتُ فَإِذَا كَانَ أَكْثَرَ مِنْ أَيَّامِهَا الَّتِي كَانَتْ تَحِيضُ فِيهِنَّ فَلْتَتَرَبَّصْ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ بَعْدَ مَا تَمْضِي أَيَّامُهَا فَإِذَا تَرَبَّصَتْ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ وَلَمْ يَنْقَطِعْ عَنْهَا الدَّمُ فَلْتَصْنَعْ كَمَا تَصْنَعُ الْمُسْتَحَاضَةُ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from ‘Abd Allah ibn ‘Amir from Ali ibn Mahziyar from al-Hassan ibn Sa‘id from Zur’ah, from Sanaa ‘ah who has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam) , about the case of a woman who experiences blood discharge before the time of her Hayd (menses) period. He (the Imam) said, ‘If she experiences blood discharge before the time of her Hayd (menses) she must stop performing Salah (prayer). Perhaps it has started earlier. If blood discharge continues for more than the period of time she normally experiences, she must wait for three days above the normal period of time and if it did not stop after three days she then must follow the procedure for one experiencing Istihadah (irregular menses).”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/207)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Women Observe Yellowish Blood Before or After Hayd (menses)
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَمُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) عَنِ الْمَرْأَةِ تَرَى الصُّفْرَةَ فِي أَيَّامِهَا فَقَالَ لاَ تُصَلِّي حَتَّى تَنْقَضِيَ أَيَّامُهَا وَإِنْ رَأَتِ الصُّفْرَةَ فِي غَيْرِ أَيَّامِهَا تَوَضَّأَتْ وَصَلَّتْ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father and Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il from af-Fadf ibn Shadhan from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from Hariz from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I once asked abu ’Abd Allah , about the case of a woman who finds a discharge of yellow color during the time of her normal period of Hayd (menses). He (the Imam) said, ‘She must not perform Salah (prayer) during the time of her normal blood discharge due to Hayd (menses). If she experiences blood discharge of yellow color in a time, which is other than the time for her normal period of blood discharge due to Hayd (menses), she must take Wudu’ and perform Salah (prayer).’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/208)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Women Observe Yellowish Blood Before or After Hayd (menses)
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) فِي الْمَرْأَةِ تَرَى الصُّفْرَةَ فَقَالَ إِنْ كَانَ قَبْلَ الْحَيْضِ بِيَوْمَيْنِ فَهُوَ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ وَإِنْ كَانَ بَعْدَ الْحَيْضِ بِيَوْمَيْنِ فَلَيْسَ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah from Ishaq ibn ‘Ammar from abu Basir who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , about a woman who experiences a blood discharge of yellow color two days before her normal time for her Hayd (menses), has said that she must not perform Salah (prayer). It is Hayd (menses). If such discharge is two days after the time of her Hayd (menses) free period, she must perform Salah (prayer). It is not Hayd (menses).”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/209)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Women Observe Yellowish Blood Before or After Hayd (menses)
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ حُكَيْمٍ قَالَ قَالَ الصُّفْرَةُ قَبْلَ الْحَيْضِ بِيَوْمَيْنِ فَهُوَ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ وَبَعْدَ أَيَّامِ الْحَيْضِ لَيْسَ مِنَ الْحَيْضِ وَهِيَ فِي أَيَّامِ الْحَيْضِ حَيْضٌ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Muhammad ibn abu ‘Abd Allah, has narrated from Mu‘awiyah ibn Hukaym who has said the following: “He (the Imam) , has said, ‘A discharge of yellowish color for two days before Hayd (menses) is of Hayd (menses) and after the days of Hayd (menses) is not of Hayd (menses); however such (discharge) during the days of Hayd (menses) is Hayd (menses).”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/209)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: First Time Hayd (menses)
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الْجَارِيَةِ الْبِكْرِ أَوَّلَ مَا تَحِيضُ فَتَقْعُدُ فِي الشَّهْرِ فِي يَوْمَيْنِ وَفِي الشَّهْرِ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ وَيَخْتَلِفُ عَلَيْهَا لاَ يَكُونُ طَمْثُهَا فِي الشَّهْرِ عِدَّةَ أَيَّامٍ سَوَاءً قَالَ فَلَهَا أَنْ تَجْلِسَ وَتَدَعَ الصَّلاَةَ مَا دَامَتْ تَرَى الدَّمَ مَا لَمْ تَجُزِ الْعَشَرَةَ فَإِذَا اتَّفَقَ الشَّهْرَانِ عِدَّةَ أَيَّامٍ سَوَاءً فَتِلْكَ أَيَّامُهَا.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ‘Uthman ibn ’Isa from Sama‘ah ibn Mehran who has said the following: “I once asked him (the Imam) , about the case of a young girl who experiences Hayd (menses) for the first time. In one month she experiences for two days and in the second month for three days and so they are not certain days of known duration every month. He (the Imam) said, ‘ She must deal with it like Hayd (menses) and stop performing Salah (prayer) as long as there is discharge which is not more than ten days. If the duration of her Hayd (menses) in two months remains the same, this establishes a pattern for her Hayd (menses).”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/210)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: First Time Hayd (menses)
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ قَالَ قُلْتُ لأَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) الْمَرْأَةُ تَرَى الدَّمَ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ أَوْ أَرْبَعَةً قَالَ تَدَعُ الصَّلاَةَ قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهَا تَرَى الطُّهْرَ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ أَوْ أَرْبَعَةً قَالَ تُصَلِّي قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهَا تَرَى الدَّمَ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ أَوْ أَرْبَعَةً قَالَ تَدَعُ الصَّلاَةَ قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهَا تَرَى الطُّهْرَ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ أَوْ أَرْبَعَةً قَالَ تُصَلِّي قُلْتُ فَإِنَّهَا تَرَى الدَّمَ ثَلاَثَةَ أَيَّامٍ أَوْ أَرْبَعَةً قَالَ تَدَعُ الصَّلاَةَ تَصْنَعُ مَا بَيْنَهَا وَبَيْنَ شَهْرٍ فَإِذَا انْقَطَعَ الدَّمُ عَنْهَا وَإِلاَّ فَهِيَ بِمَنْزِلَةِ الْمُسْتَحَاضَةِ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Yunus ibn Ya’qub who has said the following: “I once said to abu ’Abd Allah , that a woman may experience blood discharge for three or four days. He (the Imam) said, ’She must stop performing Salah (prayer).’ I then said that she might experience Hayd-free time for three or four days. He (the Imam) said, ’She must perform Salah (prayer).’ I then said that she might experience blood discharge for three or four days. He (the Imam) said, ‘She must stop performing Salah (prayer).’ I then said that she might experience blood- discharge-free time for three or four days. He (the Imam) said, ’She must perform Salah (prayer).’ I then said that she might experience blood discharge for three or four days. He (the Imam) said, ‘She must stop performing Salah (prayer) and continue as such for one month and if blood discharge did not stop she must deal with it according to the rules for Istihadah (irregular menses).”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/210)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Examining if Hayd (menses) has Ended or Not
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ إِذَا أَرَادَتِ الْحَائِضُ أَنْ تَغْتَسِلَ فَلْتَسْتَدْخِلْ قُطْنَةً فَإِنْ خَرَجَ فِيهَا شَيْ‏ءٌ مِنَ الدَّمِ فَلاَ تَغْتَسِلْ وَإِنْ لَمْ تَرَ شَيْئاً فَلْتَغْتَسِلْ وَإِنْ رَأَتْ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ صُفْرَةً فَلْتَتَوَضَّأْ وَلْتُصَلِّ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Mahbub from abu Ayyub from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “Abu Ja‘far , has stated this Hadith. Tf a woman wants Ghusl (bath), she should place a piece of cotton in her urethra. If blood is found on it, she cannot take Ghusl (bath); but if blood is not found on it, she must take Ghusl (bath) and if thereafter she finds yellowish discharge she must take Wudu’ to perform Salah (prayer).”’

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/212)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Examining if Hayd (menses) has Ended or Not
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) أَنَّهُ بَلَغَهُ أَنَّ نِسَاءً كَانَتْ إِحْدَاهُنَّ تَدْعُو بِالْمِصْبَاحِ فِي جَوْفِ اللَّيْلِ تَنْظُرُ إِلَى الطُّهْرِ فَكَانَ يَعِيبُ ذَلِكَ وَيَقُولُ مَتَى كَانَتِ النِّسَاءُ يَصْنَعْنَ هَذَا.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Mahbub from abu Hamzah who has said the following: “Once it was mentioned before Abu Ja‘far , that women, during the night, asked for a lantern to examine if blood discharge has stopped or not; and it was considered laughable. He (the Imam) said, ‘When did women do this?”’ (Meaning the proper test is with a piece of cotton)

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/212)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Examining if Hayd (menses) has Ended or Not
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ ثَعْلَبَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) أَنَّهُ كَانَ يَنْهَى النِّسَاءَ أَنْ يَنْظُرْنَ إِلَى أَنْفُسِهِنَّ فِي الْمَحِيضِ بِاللَّيْلِ وَيَقُولُ إِنَّهَا قَدْ تَكُونُ الصُّفْرَةَ وَالْكُدْرَةَ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘ Umayr from Tha’labah who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , would prohibit women to examine themselves at night during their Hayd (menses), saying that it can be a discharge of a yellowish color fluid or some kind of dirt.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/213)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Taking Ghusl (bath) Because of Hayd and the Kind of Water Needed
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ وَعَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ جَمِيعاً عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ يَحْيَى الْكَاهِلِيِّ قَالَ قُلْتُ لأَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) إِنَّ النِّسَاءَ الْيَوْمَ أَحْدَثْنَ مَشْطاً تَعْمِدُ إِحْدَاهُنَّ إِلَى الْقَرَامِلِ مِنَ الصُّوفِ تَفْعَلُهُ الْمَاشِطَةُ تَصْنَعُهُ مَعَ الشَّعْرِ ثُمَّ تَحْشُوهُ بِالرَّيَاحِينِ ثُمَّ تَجْعَلُ عَلَيْهِ خِرْقَةً رَقِيقَةً ثُمَّ تَخِيطُهُ بِمِسَلَّةٍ ثُمَّ تَجْعَلُهُ فِي رَأْسِهَا ثُمَّ تُصِيبُهَا الْجَنَابَةُ فَقَالَ كَانَ النِّسَاءُ الأوَلُ إِنَّمَا يَمْتَشِطْنَ الْمَقَادِيمَ فَإِذَا أَصَابَهُنَّ الْغُسْلُ بِقَذَرٍ مُرْهَا أَنْ تُرَوِّيَ رَأْسَهَا مِنَ الْمَاءِ وَتَعْصِرَهُ حَتَّى يَرْوَى فَإِذَا رَوِيَ فَلاَ بَأْسَ عَلَيْهَا قَالَ قُلْتُ فَالْحَائِضُ قَالَ تَنْقُضُ الْمَشْطَ نَقْضاً.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam and Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr all from ‘Abd Allah ibn Yahya al-Kahiliy who has said the following: “I once said to abu ‘Abd Allah , that today women have found a certain manner of hair dressing. One of them can find a certain device made of wool which a hair dresser uses along with certain fragrance, then places in a thin piece of fabric, then ties it up with a pin and places it over her head and then she may experience sexual relation. He (the Imam) , said, ‘Women of earlier times would only decorate their hairs at the front of their head. If they may need to take Ghusl (bath), instruct them to allow water to reach their head and wring the decorated hair so water reaches it; when water reaches it then it is not harmful. 5 I then asked about Hayd (menses) and he (the Imam) said, ‘Women experiencing Hayd (menses) must reduce it (such decoration of hairs) a great deal.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/214)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Taking Ghusl (bath) Because of Hayd and the Kind of Water Needed
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ مَحْبُوبٍ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ الْحَائِضُ مَا بَلَغَ بَلَلُ الْمَاءِ مِنْ شَعْرِهَا أَجْزَأَهَا.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from ibn Mahbub from abu Ayyub al-Khazzaz from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “Abu Ja’far , has said, ‘For Ghusl (bath) because of Hayd (menses) if wetness and moisture reaches (the skin) from hairs it is sufficient.

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/215)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Taking Ghusl (bath) Because of Hayd and the Kind of Water Needed
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الأشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ مُصَدِّقِ بْنِ صَدَقَةَ عَنْ عَمَّارِ بْنِ مُوسَى عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) فِي الْحَائِضِ تَغْتَسِلُ وَعَلَى جَسَدِهَا الزَّعْفَرَانُ لَمْ يَذْهَبْ بِهِ الْمَاءُ قَالَ لاَ بَأْسَ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Abu Ali al-Ash’ariy has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad from Ahmad ibn al-Hassan ibn Ali from ‘Amr ibn Sa‘id from Musaddiq ibn Sadaqah from ‘Ammar ibn Musa who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , about a woman who takes Ghusl (bath) because of Hayd (menses) and there is saffron on her body which is not removed with Ghusl (bath), has said, ‘It is not harmful.

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/215)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Women Find Blood after Sexual Relation
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ يَحْيَى الْكَاهِلِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الْمَرْأَةِ يُجَامِعُهَا زَوْجُهَا فَتَحِيضُ وَهِيَ فِي الْمُغْتَسَلِ تَغْتَسِلُ أَوْ لاَ تَغْتَسِلُ قَالَ قَدْ جَاءَهَا مَا يُفْسِدُ الصَّلاَةَ فَلاَ تَغْتَسِلُ.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from ‘Abd Allah ibn Yahya al-Kahiliy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about a woman who after sexual relation with her husband experiences Hayd (menses) and she is already in the bath area. Must she take Ghusl (bath) or not? He (the Imam) said, ‘Something which invalidates Salah (prayer) has come with her. She does not need Ghusl (bath).’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/216)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #2.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Women Find Blood after Sexual Relation
Hadith #2.arabicText: 2ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الْمَرْأَةِ تَحِيضُ وَهِيَ جُنُبٌ هَلْ عَلَيْهَا غُسْلُ الْجَنَابَةِ قَالَ غُسْلُ الْجَنَابَةِ وَالْحَيْضِ وَاحِدٌ.
Hadith #2.englishText: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Yunus from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah , about a woman who experiences Hayd (menses) when she has had sexual relation if she needed Ghusl (bath) because of sexual relation. He (the Imam) said, ‘Ghusl (bath) for Hayd (menses) and sexual relation is one.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/216)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #4.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Comprehensive Instructions About Hayd (menses) and Istihadah (irregular menses)
Hadith #4.arabicText: 4ـ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ قَالَ قَالَ الْمُسْتَحَاضَةُ إِذَا ثَقَبَ الدَّمُ الْكُرْسُفَ اغْتَسَلَتْ لِكُلِّ صَلاَتَيْنِ وَلِلْفَجْرِ غُسْلاً وَ إِنْ لَمْ يَجُزِ الدَّمُ الْكُرْسُفَ فَعَلَيْهَا الْغُسْلُ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ مَرَّةً وَالْوُضُوءُ لِكُلِّ صَلاَةٍ وَإِنْ أَرَادَ زَوْجُهَا أَنْ يَأْتِيَهَا فَحِينَ تَغْتَسِلُ هَذَا إِنْ كَانَ دَمُهَا عَبِيطاً وَإِنْ كَانَتْ صُفْرَةً فَعَلَيْهَا الْوُضُوءُ.
Hadith #4.englishText: 4. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from ‘Uthman ibn ‘Isa from Sama‘ah who has said the following: “He (the Imam) , has said, ‘In the case of Istihadah, if blood finds its way outthrough the cotton, she must take Ghusl (bath) for every two Salah (prayer) and one more Ghusl (bath) for the morning Salah (prayer). If blood does not come out through the cotton, then she must take one Ghusl (bath) every day and Wudu 5 for every Salah (prayer). If her husband wants to come to her, he must do so after her Ghusl (bath). This is when blood is of black color but if it is yellow, then she must take Wudu’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/226)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #5.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Comprehensive Instructions About Hayd (menses) and Istihadah (irregular menses)
Hadith #5.arabicText: 5ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الله بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) قَالَ الْمُسْتَحَاضَةُ تَغْتَسِلُ عِنْدَ صَلاَةِ الظُّهْرِ فَتُصَلِّي الظُّهْرَ وَالْعَصْرَ ثُمَّ تَغْتَسِلُ عِنْدَ الْمَغْرِبِ فَتُصَلِّي الْمَغْرِبَ وَالْعِشَاءَ ثُمَّ تَغْتَسِلُ عِنْدَ الصُّبْحِ فَتُصَلِّي الْفَجْرَ وَلاَ بَأْسَ أَنْ يَأْتِيَهَا بَعْلُهَا إِذَا شَاءَ إِلاَّ أَيَّامَ حَيْضِهَا فَيَعْتَزِلُهَا بَعْلُهَا قَالَ وَقَالَ لَمْ تَفْعَلْهُ امْرَأَةٌ قَطُّ احْتِسَاباً إِلاَّ عُوفِيَتْ مِنْ ذَلِكَ.
Hadith #5.englishText: 5. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ’Abd Allah ibn af-Mughirah from ’Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah , has said, ‘A woman experiencing Istihadah must take Ghusl (bath) for Salah (prayer) of al-Dhuhr to perform Salah (prayer) of al-Dhuhr and al-‘Asr, then take Ghusl (bath) near al-Maghrib to perform Salah (prayer) of al-Maghrib and al-Tsha’, then take Ghusl (bath) near the morning for Salah (prayer) of the morning. It is not harmful if her husband comes to her if he likes. Only in the days when she experiences Hayd (menses) he must stay away from her.’ He (the Imam), said, ‘Any woman who follows this instruction for the sake of reward from Allah enjoys good health.”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/227)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #1.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Signs for Differentiating Between Blood of Hayd and Istihadah
Hadith #1.arabicText: 1ـ عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَفْصِ بْنِ الْبَخْتَرِيِّ قَالَ دَخَلَتْ عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ الله (عَلَيْهِ الْسَّلام) امْرَأَةٌ فَسَأَلَتْهُ عَنِ الْمَرْأَةِ يَسْتَمِرُّ بِهَا الدَّمُ فَلاَ تَدْرِي حَيْضٌ هُوَ أَوْ غَيْرُهُ قَالَ فَقَالَ لَهَا إِنَّ دَمَ الْحَيْضِ حَارٌّ عَبِيطٌ أَسْوَدُ لَهُ دَفْعٌ وَحَرَارَةٌ وَدَمَ الاسْتِحَاضَةِ أَصْفَرُ بَارِدٌ فَإِذَا كَانَ لِلدَّمِ حَرَارَةٌ وَدَفْعٌ وَسَوَادٌ فَلْتَدَعِ الصَّلاَةَ قَالَ فَخَرَجَتْ وَهِيَ تَقُولُ وَالله أَنْ لَوْ كَانَ امْرَأَةً مَا زَادَ عَلَى هَذَا.
Hadith #1.englishText: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Ibn Abi ‘Umayr from Hafs ibn af-Bakhtariy who has said the following: “Once a woman came to abu ’Abd Allah , and asked about the case of a woman who experiences blood discharge which does not stop and she does not know whether it is Hayd (menses) or something else. He (the narrator) has said that he (the Imam) then said, ‘Blood discharged because of Hayd (menses) is hot, thick and of black color. It comes with pressure and hotness. Blood discharge because of Istihadah (irregular menses) is of yellow color and cold. If blood discharged is hot, comes with pressure and it is of black color, she must stop performing Salah (prayer).’ He (the narrator) said that she left saying, ‘By Allah, were it a woman she could not explain it any better than what he (the Imam) did.’”

grading.book: Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/229)
grading.author: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi

Hadith #3.title: Al-Kafi - Volume 3: Signs for Differentiating Between Blood of Hayd and Istihadah
